thread.title: Anfernee Simons scores 30 as Edgewater defeats Deltona
thread.title_full: Anfernee Simons scores 30 as Edgewater defeats Deltona - Orlando Sentinel

author: orlandosentinel.com
title: Anfernee Simons scores 30 as Edgewater defeats Deltona
text:
Anfernee Simons poured in 30 points to lead Edgewater to an 82-51 homecourt win over Deltona in a Class 7A boys basketball region final. He had nine dunks.
After a hard-fought first half, which ended with the Eagles (21-8) leading 31-25, Simons exploded in the third quarter. He threw down four gravity-defying slams during a 13-2 run that turned a competitive game into a laugher.
“It’s hard sometimes for Anfernee because of how he’s guarded, but I think he’s the best player in the state,” said Edgewater coach Jason Atherton. “It’s not just the scoring, but he passes well, defends the best players, he does it all.”
Edgewater will leave the comfort of its home gym this Friday, traveling to face Tampa Hillsborough with a trip to state on the line.
Edgewater turned up the defensive pressure and gave the Wolves fits as the game went on, creating 24 turnovers.
“If we can defend and rebound, we can run,” said Atherton. “We know we can be tough to stop in transition.”
Michael Eads added 21 points and Frank Foreman scored 13 for the Eagles.
Deltona star Blake Hinson scored 19 to lead the Wolves, but was held to 5-20 shooting.
 Varsity
